teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: USNA
teams.loan_because:
We can. Nowhere else in the world are 18-24 year-olds afforded a better opportunity to make an impact in the world.

The challenge we face is to simply convince ONE other Midshipman to join and loan ONCE.
teams.description:
We are a group of students at an institution that provides us with some the greatest opportunities in the world. 

The students and alumni in this group realize and understand that the opportunities afforded are not only to better themselves, but rather to use their talents in a productive manner. These Midshipman see the bigger picture of their situation. One that looks past the walls of the Academy and Friday nights in DTA. 

We are dedicated to making a difference. That is our profession, and micro-financing is the best way to do that.

Above all, it's only $25.

teams.name: Buffalo NY Helps
teams.loan_because: We are Buffalo, we believe in helping out (not only when someone's stuck in the snow), because the more we help, the more we can enjoy ourselves later. Buffalo isn't America's richest city, far from it, we are one of the more depressed, poorer, segregated cities in our fair country. But even with that, we recognize the world is bigger than our small city. So lend to those who need it, and enjoy the thought of helping over a beer at your favorite bar that much more later.
teams.description: We come from a blue collar town, thats well educated, but offer less opputunity than the rest of the country. We care deeply about our friendships, our families, our local culture and local sports. We generally love cold beer, football and hockey, and chicken wings.

teams.name: Maria Shriver + A Woman's Nation
teams.loan_because: For as little as $25, we can help women entrepreneurs right in our own backyard.
teams.description:
Continuing what she began as First Lady of California, Maria Shriver and A Woman’s Nation are partnering with Kiva, the world's first person-to-person microlending website, to empower thousands of women across America to become more financially independent. Our partnership shows that every loan you make to a woman entrepreneur – even $25 – will make a real difference. 

As "The Shriver Report: A Woman’s Nation Pushes Back from the Brink"* states, 1 in 3 American women lives on or near the brink of poverty. By starting or expanding her own business, a woman can lift herself and her family off the brink. JOIN US in moving women and families forward!

A Woman’s Nation™ is a nonprofit organization founded by Maria Shriver that imagines a new way forward for women and men, girls and boys. Through its multimedia initiatives and innovative partnerships, A Woman's Nation informs, inspires, and implements bold ideas into action with the goal of creating a culture where all lives and all work are respected, recognized, and valued. To learn more please visit AWomansNation.org.
 
* A project of A Woman's Nation, produced in partnership with Center for American Progress.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: KivaFriends - Agriculture Loans
teams.loan_because: we want to reduce world hunger.  This includes loans for farming, livestock, poultry, and the like.
teams.description: Our group makes loans to people that create more food for those in the world.  Many of these entrepreneurs are farmers that often request loans to help them with their crops.  Many times these loans are for a longer repayment period.

teams.name: Wind Power Now
teams.loan_because: We want to make the world a better place.
teams.description: Wind power today for a better tomorrow.  Wind power emits no greenhouse gases, no air pollution and no water pollution and it uses no water.  It requires no mining or drilling for fuel, and it produces no hazardous waste. It is a tremendous rural development tool.  For more info, see http://www.yes2wind.com , a Web site on wind created by Friends of the Earth, Greenpeace and the World Wildlife Fund.

teams.name: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders
teams.description:
This Kiva team makes loans in honor of Doctors Without Borders / Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF). Médecins Sans Frontières is an international medical humanitarian organization created by doctors and journalists in France in 1971.

According to their website, MSF provides aid in nearly 60 countries to people whose survival is threatened by violence, neglect, or catastrophe, primarily due to armed conflict, epidemics, malnutrition, exclusion from health care, or natural disasters.

MSF operates independently of any political, military, or religious agenda.  In 1999, MSF won the Nobel Peace Prize.

The Kiva team is not officially linked to MSF. All loans made in the name of this team, remain the property of the lender, and are not considered a donation.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Wind Power Now
teams.loan_because: We want to make the world a better place.
teams.description: Wind power today for a better tomorrow.  Wind power emits no greenhouse gases, no air pollution and no water pollution and it uses no water.  It requires no mining or drilling for fuel, and it produces no hazardous waste. It is a tremendous rural development tool.  For more info, see http://www.yes2wind.com , a Web site on wind created by Friends of the Earth, Greenpeace and the World Wildlife Fund.

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Hard work is often not enough to escape poverty and we gladly welcome the opportunity to give people and their businesses a fighting chance. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: Oxfam
teams.loan_because: We aim to increase the number of people who have a sustainable livelihood, access to social services, an effective voice in decisions, safety from conflict and disaster, and equal rights and status.
teams.description: A global movement of dedicated people working hard to fight poverty and injustice. We believe that respect for human rights will help lift people out of poverty.

teams.name: Colbert Nation
teams.loan_because: I am helping my fellow wealthy American friends lighten their swollen pockets to help the rest of the world prosper.
teams.description: Stephen Colbert is the host and executive producer of the Emmy-nominated series on Comedy Central, "The Colbert Report." Touted by the New York Times as "one of the best television shows of the year" and praised as "a must-watch show" by Entertainment Weekly, "The Colbert Report" has garnered ratings and critical success as one of the top shows on television.

teams.name: Hemp Out
teams.loan_because: It’s in our nature, and it’s the right thing to do.
teams.description: We’re a kind group of lenders opposed to marijuana prohibition in the United States.  We feel pot should be decriminalized, taxed, and regulated much the same way alcohol is.  It’s our goal to recruit 420 members that aren’t afraid of a little weed in order to form a community of open-minded lenders that would like to “hemp out”.      Please visit www.norml.org to learn more about cannabis legalization. There’s nothing wrong with ganja; legalize bud!

teams.loan_because: Promote equality, co-operation, freedom, and self-reliance.  Help the world's poorest elevate out of poverty.  Allow the loan recipients and NOT corporations to profit from their effort.  Help preserve our planet.
teams.description: Socialists, social democrats, Greens, Hippies, environmentalists, opponents of globalization, anti-capitalists, earth-friendly 'radicals', and other left-wingers turning ideas into action.  Individuals who consider freedom a fundamental human right, and realize that true freedom cannot exist without the equality of conditions.

teams.name: Cornell University's MicroChange
teams.loan_because:
The purpose of our organization is to perform the following:


1. Alleviate global poverty by implementing an efficient and flexible microcredit loan program and reaching out through community service.


2. Eliminate gender inequality and labor barriers.


3. Provide the necessary capital to aspiring entrepreneurs who are marginalized by traditional loan programs.


4. To educate the Cornell University community about international issues concerning poverty and global inadequacies.
teams.description:
We firmly believe that a person can make a difference with a dollar in one hand, and a passionate goal to help others in the other hand. Change can occur! Join us in that change. It only takes a local act to make a global impact.

We are very determined in our cause, and we are very friendly and are an approachable team that is always open to new ideas.

teams.description:
The Bridge located in New Town at St. Charles is a coffee house, fair trade market, and community that provides the residents in the St. Louis Metropolitan area with coffee and  items crafted by artisans and farmers from various global cultures.  Our coffee is supplied by local roaster, Goshen Coffee and out Fair Trade products are supplied by organizations such as Plowsharing Crafts, Ten Thousand Villages and A Greater Gift, with most of the profits being passed directly to those working hard to provide for their families within these developing nations.

As our name implies, we exist to bridge ethnic, racial, religious and socio-economic cultures.  We are concerned advocates, founded and supported by faith communities, desiring to bring peace, justice and dignity to the world.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                                                 
"If we donate only to Jewish causes or to individual Jews in need, we may stop seeing everyone as being equally created in God's image and therefore worthy of our help. After all, we are all members of one race, the human race." -- Rabbi Joseph Telushkin

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.

teams.name: Guys holding fish
teams.loan_because: We feel an affinity for entrepreneurs that make their living by fishing, selling fish, or attempting to make their lives better because of their proximity to the ocean, or freshwater locales...
teams.description:
We love fish and/or fishing so much that many of us have chosen to present ourselves on KIVA with a photo of ourselves, holding a fish!  We welcome "gals" to join, as well, the name of the team notwithstanding...  

We certainly support "sustainable" fishing, but also recognize that sometimes, our "Western" views of resource management may not match the needs of the very desperate folks, in other countries, struggling to make a living, or even providing food for their families ...  Our intent is to help the struggling, without regard to their profession or trade.  We believe that our lending record well represents that goal, as we are a pretty diverse group, with very diverse lending interests....

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: PAAC Students in Hawaii
teams.loan_because: We are learning about microfinance at a PAAC high school conference, and we are taking action to make a difference in the world!
teams.description: Students from Hawaii who are interested in international issues, learning that we are all connected, and aiming to be global citizens.  Anyone can join our team if you support international education, especially for youth.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Look Who's Talking Vision - LWTVision
teams.loan_because:
Creating a Hand Up creates sustainability and confidence and the ability to give to others in turn.
For every dollar we loan we recieve the satisfaction of knowing one more person is on the way to being self sustaining!
teams.description: We are one in our ability to lift each other.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.
